channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 533 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 3 Singaporeans and permanent residents
item.description:
May 27, 2020 3:09 PM

The bulk of the remaining cases are foreign workers living in dormitories.

item.title: HSA warns about 2 'health' products that contain steroids, dangerous dose of erectile dysfunction drug
item.description:
May 27, 2020 3:05 PM

SINGAPORE - The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) has warned the public to avoid buying or consuming two products as they contain potent medicinal ingredients that should not be used without medical supervision.

item.title: Phase 1 of post-Covid-19 circuit breaker: A guide to what you can do from June 2
item.description:
May 27, 2020 2:28 PM

Here are answers to frequently asked questions about the post-circuit breaker period, as well as information on which services and facilities will be reopening.

item.title: Man arrested for suspected drug offences, dangerous driving after accident injures 5 others including 2 year old
item.description:
May 27, 2020 12:13 PM

SINGAPORE - A 34-year-old man was arrested for dangerous driving and suspected drug-related offences after an accident involving three cars and a lorry on Tuesday night (May 26).

item.title: Primary 1 registration for 2021 goes fully online; new cap on intake of PR children
item.description:
May 27, 2020 11:31 AM

There will not be any in-person registration at schools for the upcoming exercise this year because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 27
item.description:
May 27, 2020 8:00 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Wednesday, May 27.

item.title: Coronavirus: One million new masks collected on Day 1
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Collecting the new and improved reusable face masks was fuss-free for many, with about a million picked up on the first day of the latest nationwide distribution exercise yesterday.

item.title: 2 Singaporeans face more charges linked to Covid-19
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A youth accused of acting on behalf of an unlicensed moneylender is said to have targeted an occupant of a Holland Close flat on April 9 - two days after safe distancing measures were introduced in Singapore due to the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: MOH names two more Jurong sites visited by infectious Covid-19 patients
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) has named the wet market at Block 963 Jurong West Street 91 and FairPrice Xtra in Jurong Point as public places visited by people with Covid-19 for more than 30 minutes when they were infectious.

item.title: Public raises $370,000 to fly cancer patient back from US
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean woman who was diagnosed with Stage 4 breast cancer while in the United States will be able to reunite with her family here, after the public raised more than $300,000 to fund her trip home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can my children return to pre-school together, can siblings pray in place of worship from June 2?
Daily Covid-19 cases in dorms likely to fall below 100 in three to four weeks' time
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The cases in dormitories will plunge in 3 to 4 weeks' time due to "broadly effective" measures to stem the spread of the virus, said an expert.

item.title: National eye centre launches telemedicine for glaucoma patients
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

"Doctor, my right eye is a little red," said Mr Tan, 70, a glaucoma patient at the Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC).

item.title: Home renovation works that were disrupted to get priority
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Home owners whose renovation works were disrupted will be given priority to restart them in phase one of the post-circuit breaker period, said Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: Singapore's public toilets dirtier since 2016: Study
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite endless exhortations to keep Singapore's public toilets clean, they have become dirtier since 2016, according to a new islandwide study of more than 1,000 toilets in hawker centres and coffee shops.

item.title: Pay waste management operators fairly amid pandemic, says advisory
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Organisations that engage waste management services should continue to pay service providers appropriately and exercise restraint in penalising them, in order to ensure that the sector remains sustainable amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Court rejects school's bid to seal case file over girl's alleged sexual assault
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A court registrar refused a school's bid to seal a case file or hold in-camera proceedings for a negligence lawsuit by parents of a seven-year-old girl allegedly assaulted by a male classmate, ruling that a gag order on the names of the two children and all identifiers, including the school's name, would suffice.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Military recruits whose basic military training (BMT) was suspended for seven weeks will graduate two to four weeks later than slated so that they can complete their training and syllabus.

item.title: SAF recruits to end BMT later after training suspension
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Military recruits who were affected by a seven-week suspension of their basic military training (BMT) will complete it two to four weeks later than scheduled.

item.title: Budget provides more to cushion downturn - and a springboard to the future
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Using the Covid-19 crisis as an opportunity, the Fortitude Budget will help to fast-track Singapore's transition to a digital economy. If all goes well, it will provide both a cushion and a springboard, says associate editor Vikram Khanna.

item.title: Recovering from schizophrenia: She once thought she had superpowers to talk to the TV set
item.description:
May 27, 2020 5:00 AM

When Ms Valerie Liu was in her early 20s, she thought she was a deity with superpowers that allowed her to talk to the radio and her television set.
